result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Transcript of Initial Appearance, 9/9/22
Transcript of Preliminary Hearing & Arraignment, 9-19-22
Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum for 10-6-22 Arraignment
Exhibit #1 - CRIMINAL COMPLAINT
re: defendant's appearance for preliminary hearing
Arraignment on October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:19 PM Defendant Donald Wayne Maier appeared by video, in custody, from Racine Correctional Institution.  Attorney Robert John Kaiser Jr in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Edward Minser in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews what has happened so far in the case. The Public Defender has not determined his eligibility for Counsel as defendant will not meet with him. Transport was sent to Racine Correctional, but defendant refused to come out of his cell and be transported. He is currently in his cell and a video is set up in front of his cell. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today.  
David Bailey is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Kaiser. He is a detective with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. Exhibit #1, Criminal Complaint, is marked and reviewed with witness and received. He testifies as to the murder on 7/17/2005. He reviews the 911 call. Victim's wife was present in the home. A knife was missing from the kitchen. Victim was pronounced deceased in the bedroom. The autopsy showed a 4 1/2 stab wound which pierced his lungs. The manner of death was homicide. He has met with defendant in prison.  He believes the person in the cell is the defendant.  He spoke to the garbage disposal person who indicated that the garbage was picked up at 11:00 a.m. on Wednesdays, and July 17 was a Wednesday. Defendant indicated that he had a sexual relationship with victim's wife. Victim's wife initially denied it, but later admitted to it after defendant admitted to it.  Defendant was in the jail in 2012 and admitted to other inmates that he had stabbed victim. He told them at he had disposed of the murder weapon and his clothes and it was taken by the garbage truck that morning. On 5/5/22, he spoke to an inmate at Racine Correctional Institution when they were in a holding cell together and defendant told him that he committed a homicide in the 1980's and he was having an affair with the victim's wife. He told him that he put the knife in the garbage and was taken by the garbage truck that morning. He testifies as to other things the inmate told him that he knows are true.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.  Arraignment will be held at a later date. Bond is continued.

1:36 PM Attorney Robert John Kaiser Jr in court for State of Wisconsin. Lieutenant appears via video from Racine Correctional Institution. Defendant refuses to appear and gave the lieutenant a letter to submit into evidence. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment. He will need to appear for future appearances.
